Reviews.Title: “Best event service ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sheryl J
Reviews.Content: Thank you, Thank you, to Event Coordinator Augustina Porter at the Hotel San Carlos. My daughter is getinng married next weekend and we will have a large party staying at the hotel. Augustina has been more then helpful!! From changing the bride's and family suites at the last minute, to corrdinating a fabulous mani/pedi party at a nearby salon for my daughter and her bridesmaids. I am more then satified with the excellent service so far and if her staff is half as attentive as she this promises to be a wonderful weekend!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay for the location”
Reviews.Author: Rathskeller
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel San Carlos with a group to see the NCAA Tournament. It's a nicet little hotel right downtown, next to the light rail. Great location within walking distance of the USAirways Arena and Chase Field with plenty of places to eat and drink nearby. It's an old hotel, but they've done a good job of keeping it up. It's clean, the staff is nice, the bed was comfy. It has some strange design features and quirky decor, but you get that with an older hotel. That was more than offset by the fantastic rooftop pool and deck -- hanging out there with a cooler of beer was a great way to wind down from the day. Not sure what all the grief is about on some of these reviews -- it was a nice little old hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Sad, tired, and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: sopas87
Reviews.Content: I love character hotels, and rate some older hotels as my very favorites. But the San Carlos is just dingy and inadequate. The rooms look like a place you check in to kill yourself (maybe that's why the windows don't open): drab, featureless, and slighltly dirty. Cracked tiles throughout the tiny bathroom. No room service, no restaurant really on site (there is something called the Ghost Lounge, but it's just a dusty, joyless bar). The fitness center is a random room with a few machines scattered about, including a non-functioning treadmill. Ignorant staff -- I asked for directions to a meeting that was just two blocks away, and was sent in the opposite direction. And all this for $199 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chris H
Reviews.Content: I was visiting Phoenix with 2 friends and found the Hotel San Carlos through a popular online booking site. I was originally pleased when I called the hotel to see if they offered any additional discounts from the online source and they knocked ~$20 off the per night price. The rating was 3.5 stars so we opted to book 3 rooms for 3 nights. Upon arrival the hotel has a very small lobby with quaint features. It wasn't until we actually went to the rooms and realized that the hotel is very outdated and not as clean as hoped. Our stay went downhill once we first went to the hotel bar for a quick drink prior to dinner and the entire lobby smelled horribly like a sewage leak. That night when ready for bed each of the 3 rooms were at least 75 degrees F with no thermostat control. My particular room was perhaps in the 80s all night with me sleeping on top of the sheets and sweating nearly the entire time. Central air conditioning in a hotel???? The walls might have well been paper since everything in the neighboring room was audible. All three of us independently opted to leave this hotel first thing in the morning upon congregating. Apparently we weren't the first people to opt leaving this hotel so they included a mandatory $50 fee for early check out but said we can dispute the charge with our credit card. We moved to a name brand hotel just across the street for $30 more and were absolutely satisfied. Don't stay at this hotel. The small savings are not worth it. This is a 1-2 star hotel at best.

Reviews.Title: “Charming to visit but not to stay”
Reviews.Author: FLR
Reviews.Content: I was attending a conference and this was one of the hotels on our list. From the outside the hotel looks charming but then rooms left a lot to be desired. The rooms are small. I felt as if my roommate and I were on top of each other. The bathroom is very dated. The water pressure was poor and the water temperature was not reliable. The paint was peeling from the tub and the mirror was difficult to use if you are not a tall person. The worst part was the electrical socket was on top of the mirror. To use the blow dryer I had to close the lid of the toilet and stand on top while balancing myself as I plugged the in the dryer. I only wish I had taken a picture. If that is not bad enough the walls are paper thin. Our neighbors were not talking loud, they were talking in a normal tone, but with the paper thin walls it seemed as if my neighbors were sitting at the end of my bed. During the day it’s not so bad but at midnight it was terrible. I would not recommend this hotel if you are looking for a comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Rewriting history in its rating”
Reviews.Author: Fataitaa
Reviews.Content: I booked a three night stay with a popular online service. It gave the San Carlos a 3.5 out of 5. The rate was about $60 less than a much better name brand hotel around the corner. When I arrived I was told I did not have a reservation. I assured the counter person I indeed had one. They were insistant I did not. I produced the confirmation number "hmm, that's not our number". I produced the booking receipt and asked for the manager after additional explaining and 20 minutes she had to make the reservation on the spot. I know this hotel had a grand history and boy are they doing their best to keep it just like it was in the 50's. Just a short list of deficiencies; Uncontrolable shower temp. scald to cold in milliseconds. No heat or cooling control. They say just open or close the vent. So 170 rooms are treated as one. The original elevators are old and creaky and I think they were the first one west of the Mississippi. And slow! They even post inside the elevator that they are subject to breaking and to be gentle. The walls have been pained so many times that it's hard to tell where one wall starts and the other ends. Even so the sound of the next rooms occupants was interesting. No room service If they promoted this monument as exactly what it is " a chance to stay in a really historic hotel with 1928 detail". And play up the ghost thing even more than they do now, some masochistic patrons would love it. One positive was the wireless was actually fast and free. Pay a little more and Avoid this classic, old, rundown, overpriced, uncomfortable relic.

Reviews.Title: “A good little hotel but not fancy!”
Reviews.Author: CSBD4
Reviews.Content: This is a nice little hotel. It is not very fancy (yes it is old) but if you are looking for a cost efficient and good location in the downtown area this is a good choice. Yes you can hear the noise from other rooms but it was not too bad during my stay. The restaurant downstairs is great and very reasonable. I also had a great lunch at Tom's Tavern down the road from the Convention Centre. A good stay while traveling on business.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY!!”
Reviews.Author: mdrivera
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a conference and it was terrible! I understand it is an old building but old buildings don't have to be dirty and falling apart. Poor, poor, poor, terrible value for what you pay (on this occasion a "special" conference rate of $199). Tiles in the bathroom were chipped, dirty, and in need of repair, the "art" on the wall was falling apart inside the frame, the pillows smelled like they were washed in beer, furniture and doors had chipped paint, you can hear your neighbors coughing and taking showers, your skin is scalded in the shower whenever someone flushes the toilet in your wing of the hotel, and there is a story and picture of a rape and murder line up next to the elevator. If that run-on sentence doesn't detract you then look at the rest of the reviews on here-- more than half of them seem like fake 4* ratings and the rest tell the true story and echo my complaints.

Reviews.Title: “a piece of history...”
Reviews.Author: hphila
Reviews.Content: this hotel is one, great piece of phoenix history; yes, it's very old and yes, it's very antique; building as well as furniture - not recommended to anyone allergic to old world history of the hotel san carlos; great history lesson...

Reviews.Title: “Historic Phoenix Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Darlene43
Reviews.Content: One of America's Historic Hotel but in need of TLC. Bathroom had chipped tiles and dirty grout. Small room, definitely not for families. You're walking distance to Chase Park and U.S. Airways arena so if you're going to a baseball or basketball game, downtown Phoenix is dead. The hotel is mentioned as one of Travel Channel's most haunted hotels. In its prime, many celebrities stayed at the hotel. Also mentioned that the hotel is briefly seen in the original Psycho with Janet Leigh.

Reviews.Title: “This is just my style”
Reviews.Author: Julia K
Reviews.Content: This is just what I like. Beautiful building, staff at the reception good-humored and very friendly, beautiful rooms. And I loved the frames in the lobby and in the bar that showed photos and newspaper articles that told a lot about the place's interesting history. I also liked it very much that everything was well looked after and clean, but not refurbished to death. I know that some people need a bathroom that looks like built in two months ago, but I totally loved the old bathtub and the beautiful tiles in the San Carlos. For breakfast, you get vouchers for the coffee bar at the corner. This is very nice and a good value as well. I will definitively come back, if I'm in Arizona again!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel San Carlos - Interesting and Affordable”
Reviews.Author: LadyJLasVegas
Reviews.Content: We chose Hotel San Carlos after checking Tripadvisor because it's within easy walking distance of Symphany Hall and costs about half what the chain area hotels cost. We only needed 1 night before moving on elsewhere. This is a good, affordable, safe choice - but know what you're getting. San Carlos is intentionally a 1940's style hotel. The rooms are small - the bathroom is tiny - but we've stayed in upscale hotels in Paris and London with less room. They've left some of the old features, some operational, some not. Yes, the tile and brass shows its age - but it's real tile and brass. The bedding is new, spotless, and comfortable. We were very worried about room temperature because the window didn't open and the AC is not controlled in the room. There's a ceiling fan. We like it cool at night. We had the best night's sleep of the trip. Staff were helpful and overall nice. The location is perfect...and so was the price. Oh - and the Metro from the airport stops half a block from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location But Low Value”
Reviews.Author: IchiroK
Reviews.Content: We were in town for the Arizona R&R Marathon. This hotel is centrally located in downtown and the price was decent. And, this attracted some rude customers. There were two disturbances outside our room in the wee hours of the morning and I felt unsafe. Security arrived after the muckrakers left. Not good right before a 26.2 run. The room was small but the bathroom was clean and functional. The Wi-Fi and TV worked adequately. However, everything was just crammed in - desk, chair, TV chest, etc. Beer or something was spilled in the elevator (wood flooring) and it was not cleaned in a timely manner. The staff was friendly enough but the desk folks did not seemed too concerned for the customers experience. The parking situation was "as advertised" but made the overall value drop even lower. Fortunately, Saturday night after 8pm is free downtown street parking. We were able to park 100 yards away. The property is adjacent to a pub with outdoor seating and it also has street seating. The funny thing is that in the evening, the customer has to walk through smoke to get to the non-smoking premises. I will not be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: MegTilly
Reviews.Content: We had no hot water, the TV was broken, the carpet has never (EVER) been cleaned. The Excercise room consisted of 3 machines, of which one was working. There was nowhere to get coffee before 7am. The manager: ANGELA HENTZ is the rudest person I have ever met. I would not go near this place with a ten foot pole. We were charged for a night that we did not even stay there and had to have our credit card company fight for our money back. Do yourself a favor and go to the Westin down the street, they have an amazing staff and a wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel EVER”
Reviews.Author: annie b
Reviews.Content: I had no hot water, the t.v. was broken, it smelled, we could hear the people next door (thin walls), it was sketchy at night, the exercise equipment was also broken, and worst of all the staff was so rude. This hotel charged me for a night's stay that i wasn't there for, and then couldn't reverse the charges and gave me some weird line about not believing me. The manager, Angela Hentz, said i was mean. I had to dispute it through my credit card company. DO NOT STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Historic (Old) Hotel in Downtown”
Reviews.Author: visitsoon21
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel is mediocre. The staff often seemed tired and uninterested. There also isn't much of a concierge. The room (single queen) was an okay size. The room I stayed in was clean and had an eclectic mix of antique and refurbished furniture. The bathroom was not huge but served its purpose. There was a good size closet in the room, a large window, as well as a sitting area for two and a desk which were all in good condition. I liked that they provided hot chocolate as well as tea and coffee. The walls certainly are thin but I didn't find this hotel noisy at night. Also, the carpets in the hallway were very old and the hotel could use some upgrades to make it feel more inviting and...clean. The internet connection is shaky and the computers in the "business room" (for which you have to leave your ID at front desk to get a key to) are old and the printer was also out of service. The hotel is located within walking distance to many restaurants and 'attractions' in downtown Phoenix, including the convention center. I would recommend this hotel for business travelers that are interested in experiencing a historic hotel and want to be within walking distance to several amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Historic Phoenix with Character”
Reviews.Author: Cooch6582
Reviews.Content: First off, as other have mentioned, if you want luxury and amenities, stay at the other chain hotels in the area. If you want to relive a little history and don't mind the inconveniences of an old hotel, San Carlos is a gem. Everything you would want from a vintage boutique hotel complete with ghost sightings (2nd and 7th floors!), history galore, famous guests and great staff. The place oozes with classical charm with all of the vintage accents, minimal invasive remodeling and beautiful architecture. If you stay, you can ask the staff for a tour of the owner's penthouse suite and back of house tour to see some of the famous suites where Marilyn Monroe and Mae West stayed during their visit to the San Carlos (Thanks Tina!!!) We all had a great time and appreciate you taking the time to show us around. The only downside (to be expected in a circa 1928 hotel is the small rooms, fair mount of noise and most bothersome is the water changing drastic temperatures when showering from others in the hotel flushings toilets etc.. Oh well, it just wouldn't be the same if these were not present. An overall fun experience and f you don't spend the night it is still worth a visit to look around.

Reviews.Title: “Like everyone says, be prepared for what you're going to get”
Reviews.Author: sckjc42
Reviews.Content: And I was. It's historic, it has character, it's a little bit funky and full of personality. It's not the Westin, the Wyndham, the Sheraton, or any of other chain hotels in the area, all of which have the same personality (none) but all of which are cleaner, have more amenities, fewer drunks, and less craziness. Me? I liked it, since I liked a bit of adventure. Unlike other people, my room was always clean (and cleaned very nicely every day), the beds were pretty comfortable, the lights made weird noises (yes, that frightened me once), and the water never stayed at the same temperature (I learned, after a couple of days, to move away from the shower if I heard another toilet flushing in another room... to avoid being scalded), but the internet was fast, the tub was big enough for my fat butt to sit in and soak, the water was hot, and staff were nice, and the sense of history gave this place a personality. Remember... it's not for everyone. If you like feeling like a princess, don't stay here. But if you like having a connection to a place that movie stars of old used to stay at (and probably thoroughly enjoyed), then give this place a try.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Personality”
Reviews.Author: Tamhud13
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because the block rooms were sold out at the designated hotels for our conference. I was glad I found the Hotel San Carlos. This is not your hotel if you want a Hyatt or Westin experience. This is the place for you if you enjoy history and a little of the out of the ordinary. It 's decor is dated, but what what you'd expect for a historic hotel. It is very clean and has all the modern conveniences. The pool area was very nice and a great place to relax. I stayed in the Marilyn Monroe Suite which consisted of 2 rooms and was great for having guests. Staff were friendly and helpful. I would definitely recommend this if you want something with a little more personality. Unfortunatley, I had no ghostly encounters, but enjoyed my restful nights.

Reviews.Title: “THE WORST HOTEL I HAVE EVER BEEN TO”
Reviews.Author: Dina A
Reviews.Content: I went there for a business trip, they gave me a key to a room that was already full, I had to go back and ask for another one. The carpet was full of stains and bathroom had mold and rust. stay away from this hotel if you want to have a good night of sleep, I heard weird noises all night and couldn't sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Saw no ghosts”
Reviews.Author: Pereirra
Reviews.Content: First of all, if you are a high maintenance type of person, you'll hate this hotel. It is old, and its charm is in that it isn't a polished gem. And unpolished it is! However, it is a historic hotel, with a history, and a unstated beauty that I, for one, was quite fond of. Throughout the hotel, different vignettes of former yesteryear guests and celebrities are situated on walls by the elevators. There is even a tour the hotel gives (for a small fee) of the ghosts also cohabit the hotel. Some small distractions. The water vacillates between hot and cold, the room are not very sound proof, there is a limited selection of channels on the television. On the upside, the staff is courteous and professional. The mattresses are outstanding. Even the housekeeping staff are polite, and respectful. Rooms are small, but adequate. Hey, I liked this hotel. See it for what it is and not for what it isn't. I only regret not taking my wife. It would have been a fun stay over.

Reviews.Title: “The Line between historic and filthy”
Reviews.Author: Ajspinney
Reviews.Content: I am a young businesswoman, and I stayed at the Hotel San Carlos because it was conveniently located. That's about the only good thing I can say about it, other than it truly was historic. I loved the history, but there is a line between historic and filthy. When I reached my room at 11pm after a late check-in, there was an extensive puddle of brown water on the ledge under my mirror. The sink was covered in black filth. The standards of cleanliness are subpar at this establishment, and are in need of drastic improvement before I could possibly recommend it to anyone. It is also above a pub, and I heard drunk people yelling into the night as I was trying to go to sleep that night, even though it was just a Wednesday and downtown Phoenix is usually pretty calm. They do not serve breakfast, and the nearest Starbucks isn't within easy walking distance if you have a morning appointment. Overall, I maintained a sense of humor about everything, but I wouldn't recommend it if you aren't willing to do that. My second and thankfully final night at the Hotel San Carlos, my neighbors were apparently roped in to getting an extremely drunk, loud woman back into her room, which was right across the hall from mine. It felt like my college freshman dorms all over again! Unlike the filth of my room, this situation was not the management's fault, but it's a result of the location that should be kept in mind. There are other, better hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Charming Historic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HistoryNutCalifornia
Reviews.Content: I loved the historic nature of this hotel, and my room was beautiful, clean, and very comfortable. I loved the old-fashioned light fixtures, chandeliers, and "oddities" that were period-related. The hotel is well maintained and you can see evidence of the upgrades that have taken place over the decades (in wiring, cable, fixtures, etc.). The only downside to the hotel is due to its historic nature: 1) plumbing: when someone in another room flushed, my shower temp changed (just like at home!) 2) there are no individual climate controls in the room. The hotel heats or cools and you can open or close your vent. (This was not a problem for me; I was VERY comfortable) 3) There are open "transoms" on the doors which means you can hear your neighbors more than usual. One night it was loud; the other was quiet. Overall I loved the charm and beauty of this property!! And I enjoyed the newspaper articles on the walls discussing famous guests or ghostly rumors.

Reviews.Title: “Historic San Carlos Hotel...you aren't going to find anything else that compares..”
Reviews.Author: Cinnamontoastgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last New Years Eve. We found the hotel to be wonderful; a rare find in that this is a historic hotel that has not had the charm remodeled out of it. The location is great, downtown in the middle of much of Phoenix's best night spots. The area was a good place to be for New Years Eve (for Phoenix). Hanny's is a lovely bar/ restaurant in walking distance to the hotel... it's a renovated mid-century department store. This would be a convenient hotel for a downtown pub crawl as well. The rooms are indeed small, and the bathrooms are tiny, with period fixtures. I found these facts charming; if you want a giant bathroom counter, this isn't your hotel. We found the restaurant downstairs to be inadequately equipped for the huge crowd that showed up wanting breakfast New Years Day....but that is probably just due to the holiday. We had to walk to breakfast elsewhere. This place was also loud at night...but it was New Years, so that is understandable. We would absolutely go back if we have the chance. This was a rather glamorous spot to spend New Years, a very "old hollywood" feeling. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: DLFitzpatrick
Reviews.Content: The Hotel San Carlos is a hidden jewel in downtown Phoenix. It's one of the city's most historic buildings, rich in history, and staying there is a unique and wonderful experience. In its heyday, the Hotel San Carlos was a favorite of the Hollywood set. You can stay in Marilyn Monroe's suite, Mae West's suite, or rooms where Clark Gable, Spencer Tracy and other icons stayed while in Phoenix. The owner of the hotel is a Phoenix history buff and published author; the hallways on all 7 floors are filled with old photographs and news clippings about the city and its history. We got a kick out of the story about the hotel being haunted by the ghost of a girl who threw herself from the 7th floor. I couldn't help but rave about this hotel to the manager as I left. She showed her appreciation by giving my son and I a tour of the entire place. Everything about this hotel makes you feel like you're living the life of luxury in the '30s, which is a fantastic experience. You won't get that at any of the more modern hotels in Phoenix. It's historic, but it's clean and well appointed and has all the conveniences of a modern hotel. The only negatives about the Hotel San Carlos are parking (valet parking is $20/day, but not easily discovered; but the parking problem is typical of all downtown hotels) and the restaurant, the Ghost Lounge, which is a separate leased operation - it doesn't fit the character of the rest of the hotel. There is an adjoining coffee shop, however, which serves breakfast and lunch. I won't stay anywhere else when I'm in Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “One of our BEST hotel experiences ever . . . can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: Burchpastor
Reviews.Content: More than any hotel I've ever seen, the San Carlos seems to inspire a "love it" or "hate it" type response; no one seems to be neutral. Well, put me down in the "LOVE it" category! My wife and I spent 4 nights there back in June while we were in Phoenix for a convention and would gladly have made it 4 WEEKS if we could have! We loved everything about the hotel! Having read the reviews on here, we were braced for the worst--but were pleasantly surprised in every regard! From the moment we arrived, the staff could not have been any more helpful or accommodating! After one minor mix-up, they more than compensated for that by giving us complimentary breakfast vouchers for the duration of our stay. When we expressed interest one night in trying a particular restaurant elsewhere in Phoenix (several miles away), the staff printed out directions for us & were eagerly awaiting our return later that night to hear our impressions of the restaurant; on another occasion, they took care of arranging a cab for us, etc. Extremely helpful and accommodating in every regard! Our room was far more spacious than the reviews here had led me to expect--and beautifully decorated and appointed! The central air (which you almost never find in newer hotels) was an especially nice surprise. There was a brief period one night when my wife complained of hearing noise from the neighbors (I myself was out at the time) but that was it; neither of us ever noticed any disturbance whatsoever the entire rest of the time. In fact, everything about our stay at the San Carlos was about as restful, tranquil, and peaceful as could be imagined! As others have mentioned, the location of the hotel is ideal: not only is there a light rail stop right outside the doors, we were within easy walking distance (5 min. or so) of the convention center and MANY fine restaurants! We didn't have a bad meal the entire week! Also walked to an AZ Diamondbacks game one night. If you enjoy getting away from the cookie-cutter sameness of modern chains and are up for a place with a real history, vintage feel, distinctive character, and loads of charm--then the Hotel San Carlos is just the ticket! We have nothing but warm and wonderful memories of our week there and would gladly have stayed far longer if we could have! Our convention will be meeting in Phoenix once again in about 5 years and we have every intention of staying at the San Carlos next time around also if there's any way possible; we're already looking forward to a return visit!

Reviews.Title: “Web site schmebsite”
Reviews.Author: stephenivypin
Reviews.Content: Too bad you can't smell pictures. Don't stay here...The lobby is dingy, carpet not clean...I lasted 10 minutes and left. I was told there would be a fee of $50.00 to withdraw my reservation which I agreed to pay. Two days later I was charged $187.00 for one nights stay and the cancellation fee. I called and disputed this charge and was told that the desk clerk was wrong. The final response from the manager was..."I cannot reverse any fees because our computer system is not capable of doing that." Some things are humorous...others are funny...but that is laughable. I am certain, based on my reviews of the overall reviews, this Hotel can't afford to reverse charges for early checkouts or they would go out of business. Stay somewhere else...it will be worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Lukewarm Hotel”
Reviews.Author: medcat3
Reviews.Content: Located in the heart of downtown Phoenix, this hotel makes an ideal place to stay for concerts, sporting events and concerts. It is a historic hotel which can be neat and funky at times. However this is also where San Carlos' troubles lie. First off, the walls are paper thin (conversations nose blowing, etc. Were easily heard by me). The rooms are tiny, as well. The hotel seems clean however the dated-appearing carpet, furniture etc. makes you wonder when the last time this place was updated. Given it's location, this hotel could be even better if the owners updated it while keeping some of the place's historic charm (the old school bathroom in the room is awesome). Overall, not a bad place to stay in downtown Phoenix. But if you can find someplace newer, bigger, and cheaper in the neighborhood, I'd go for that option, instead.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location In Downtown Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: kmjg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel because our daughter was playing in the 2011 Volleyball Festival at the Phoenix Convention Center. The location was outstanding. Easy access off of Interstates 10 and 17 to the property. The hotel is a short three block walk to the Phoenix Convention Center where the tournament was being held. There is a Metro Light Rail stop right outside the front door of this hotel. Staff was friendly and courteous!. Food at the hotel was great and well priced. I had a hamburger special for just $6.00 one afternoon. Happy hour at the bar was great - the coldest beer I have had in a while (it was 155 one afternoon - we needed to cool off!). It is an historical property, so understand it is not a brand new Marriott. But give it a try and you'll enjoy it - we did!

Reviews.Title: “Great location... not much else”
Reviews.Author: MrsLatts
Reviews.Content: We booked our accommodation online direct through the hotel and it was 1 nights stay including a cocktail and breakfast and airport pickup. Firstly I have to say, we went to watch a NBA Phoenix Suns game and the location to that was great. We walked there and around town easily. Thats about it though... When we arrived in and called to let them know we were here and to find out where the bus would pick us up - no-one answered the phone. We didn't think it was far (which it wasn't) from the airport so caught a cab. Got there early and the room was ready which was great. The room was quaint but the novelty wore off when it took about 30min for the water in the shower to go from freezing to luke warm where it stayed and we also couldn't get the heat in the room working. It is an old building, was winter and after my cold shower I needed heat! We also didn't get any information or vouchers for the cocktail, breakfast or wifi so went to reception to ask. The receptionist told us he would send them up. They never arrived... The next morning we wandered through the restaurant & snoop at what the free breakfast was and decided not to chase our vouchers again, we just left and ate at the airport. Maybe if you are into the old style charm of the place stay or want something on the cheaper side in town this is for you but if you want any type of comfort - give it a miss.

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown location”
Reviews.Author: ZONATRVLRS
Reviews.Content: Charming historic hotel right downtown. Sports, arts, shopping, great dinning and nightlife are all within easy walking distance, plus it's right on the light rail line. The hotel staff was substandard with maybe one or two exceptions. The rooms are anything but soundproof although that's not a surprise for a vintage hotel like the San Carlos. Still the dismal front desk service and somewhat noisy rooms at night are not enough to keep us from returning for future stays. Our lone tip would be to skip the hotel's complimentary breakfast and afternoon cocktail but do check out the rooftop pool & deck.

Reviews.Title: “Do not book this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CilleM
Reviews.Content: We have been on a roadtrip in California, Nevada and Arizona. This hotel is our worst ecperience. We booked this hotel, like all of our hotels, through a travel agent earlier this year and we were supposed to stay here for two nights. We leaved after 2 hours! The room was small, looked old and smelled horrible. It was obvious that the room had not been cleaned, because we found dead cockroaches on the floor next to our bed. The bathroom was also very small and definetely needs an update! If you want to take a shower, you have to shower in either ice cold water og extremely hot water. We booked another hotel in Phoenix, Radisson Hotel Phoenix City Center, and we were very pleased with that.

Reviews.Title: “Great place if you do not shower or use the internet”
Reviews.Author: LMT1113
Reviews.Content: First, I would like to state, the staff was great, very nice and sympathetic. This is a great place if one is travelling for pleasure and you prefer to bathe rather than shower. Every time someone in the hotel flushes the toliet or turns on the water, the shower becomes SCALDING hot, I was constantly adjusting the temperature to adjust to the extreme changes. If the shower was the only issue I would give a higher rating; however, the internet issues were atrocious. I was attending a conference at the Hyatt and due to company restrictions could not stay so we decided to stay across the street at the San Carlos. We arrived on Sunday and could not get an internet connection until I returned home. We actually had to "borrow" wifi from Arizona State and even that was iffy. Another guest mentioned she had to sit in the stairwell in order to get a signal. My colleague and I carried our laptops to S'bucks, Subway and the Irish pub next door so we could work. It was horrible. I would only recommend if the hotel updated their plumbing, wireless and cleaned the carpet more frequently. Oh, one more thing, if you decide to stay, bring earplugs; you can hear EVERYTHING from the rooms next door.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to finish a vacation in the Southwest. My husband and had a 2 nights stay, a great goodbye to SW.”
Reviews.Author: annerich1
Reviews.Content: Great view of the city from the pool/deck area, train outside the door. Staff so helpful and fun, Our room was so right, a bit of someplace else, imagination and care went into and has stayed at this hotel. Make sure to visit the other floors, surprises of previous guest.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint old hotel...great service!”
Reviews.Author: yukonmom
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights while attending a conference because the rates were about $70 less than a neighboring hotel chain. Other colleagues got their rooms for even less by booking 21 days out. Location is within a block of the light rail station and about four blocks to the convention center. Historic hotel with each room a little different. The first night I was on the 3rd floor at the end of the hall where there was an access door (figured it was a fire escape). I don't like this type of location as a single woman traveling alone but didn't complain until the next morning after an incident that night that made me feel unsafe. The room was right next to the vending/ice machine room and about midnight two men were banging the vending machine (which was on the shared wall as my room) attempting to break in apparently. It went on for about 5 minutes then I heard them leave. Didn't sleep well after that...and I could hear the ice machine every 30 minutes. The room was also very hot even after calling down to the front desk the first evening and asking if there was a/c (no). She told me to check the antique heater on the wall and it was turned off. Only found out the next morning from another staff member that there is also a vent that is used to pump heat/air through the entire hotel that I could have closed too but was not told about this. There was a ceiling fan in the room that help move the warm air around. Fortunately, I was given a new room the next morning (again at the end of the hall but it was a dead end, not one with an access door to the pool/vending/ice machines. I closed the vent and made sure the heater was turned off and slept more comfortably and in quiet. The first room's bathroom was also very, very tiny. Shower head was too short I had to scrunch down and it was smaller than most closets. And no counter space for toiletries but there is a cabinet above the sink that worked. Had to curl my hair in the room because, again, no counter space. Nice pool on the 3rd floor for some quiet time and free breakfast was okay (plain or omelette, has browns, and toast), but juice is not included and pricey (nearly $4...milk a little cheaper at ~$3). Great little Irish Pub next door offers good food and service. Beds were comfortable and bath amenities plentiful and nice. Would stay again if need to be downtown near convention center mainly for the room rates.

Reviews.Title: “A weekend in downtown Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: Phoenixfunmom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel San Carlos for two nights in December. We are from Phoenix, but were going to an event downtown and didn't want to drive late at night. After reading some of the reviews, I was hesitant to stay there, but I was pleasantly surprised. The hotel is almost 85 years old. Yes the bathrooms are small and the rooms are small, but those are things to be expected in a historic hotel. The room was beautifully furnished, the beds were comfortable, the bathroom was clean and the staff was very helpful and accommodating. We enjoyed the breakfast at the cafe in lobby. If you want to stay in the sterile, boring environment of a cookie cutter hotel that is the same from city to city, then go ahead. The Hotel San Carlos gave us the flavor of old Phoenix and we got to learn about the history of the city that we live in. Please be open minded when you stay in a historic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charming old hotel”
Reviews.Author: csteen
Reviews.Content: This is a charming old hotel in the middle of the hotel/business district - and half the price of the big hotels around it. My room had two queen sized beds and a city view -- not huge, but certainly adequate. It clearly had been freshly repainted, etc. -- furnishings old fashioned in keeping with the character of the hotel. Didn't look worn. Nice pictures on the walls. Nice large TV. Bathroom small but adequate. Good hot telephone shower over tub - which I prefer. Staff members were all very pleasant and helpful. Included breakfast made to order - much better than comparable chain hotels. After reading some of the negative reviews, I was almost afraid to stay here. I don't understand where they were coming from. This is a delightful hotel, and i recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Only as a Last Resort”
Reviews.Author: tbolson2
Reviews.Content: At this hotel right now. Other than the tiny rooms, tinier bathrooms, antiquated plumbing, cold showers, tissue paper walls and lack of room service, this would be a great hotel. What a disappointment. I have stayed in better Holiday Inns. I have also stayed in very nice older "boutique" hotels before; this surely isn't one of them. Website says "free" wireless internet. Well that is only for 30 mins then you pay. I can literally hear and understand every word of the people in the room next door talking at a normal decibal level. I know their shower doesn't work at all, by the way, and I have never seen nor spoken with them. You can't adjust temp in room at all. I am here for a convention and did not have a choice for hotel if I wanted to stay with my co-workers. Now everything is booked nearby so I have to stay. Now I know why I had to acknowledge the $50 early departure policy when I checked-in. They must be making big bucks off of that.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: Yankeefan27
Reviews.Content: Great friendly staff, very clean everywhere in the building, bed was comfortable,lots of pillows, just what we were expecting from a Hotel that was built in 1928. Would go back again for sure...

Reviews.Title: “Very Charming”
Reviews.Author: Moonshadow_10
Reviews.Content: All I can say is Wow! What a beautiful hotel!!! I thought I was in a different era! The chandeliers were absolutely gorgeous. The hotel itself was so elegant and very clean. Although our room and bathroom was small, but that part of the charm. After all it was built with the European flair. Check out the third floor where Merilyn Monroe suite is located. Can you imagine?? I don't know what the other people expect, but I thought it was just beautiful. I wish I could have been there when all the movies stars stayed there. Like Hollywood away from Hollywood!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I've ever stayed at for the price paid”
Reviews.Author: peamomma
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel San Carlos in downtown Phoenix for 4 nights while at a conference. I couldn't get into the Hyatt or Wyndham (which were the same conference price). They make you sign a statement that you will be charged a $50 fee if you depart early-that should have been my first clue that this hotel was going to be awful. This is a "historic hotel" (read old and run-down). The rooms are small. The bed is lumpy and hard. The pillows are like rocks. (They don't provide down pillows, only foam pillows that have been washed a lot and are lumpy). The bathroom has the original fixtures and cracked tile. The shower is the size of a phone booth with a shower curtain (don't drop your soap, or you will need to step outside of the shower to retrieve it, because you can't bend down in the shower - and I'm 5'3" and of average weight). The towels are thin and old. There are louvers over the door mean that you hear every noise in the hallway (the walls are so thin that I could hear the phone conversations from across the hallway). Being an old hotel, there are a lot of creaks and noises all the time. There are no individual A/C or heating controls in the room, so you are stuck with whatever temperature they have for the entire hotel. They do have ceiling fans in the room, so that helps in the summer. There are no services in the hotel-room service, breakfast, etc., though they have a bar for nighttime. On the good side, the hotel is 2 blocks from the convention center and they provide free wireless internet, though it goes out frequently. Supposedly, this hotel is haunted (several deaths occurred decades ago), but I didn't experience any "ghosts". Bottom line, for the price I paid, this is the worst hotel I've ever stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible room - small, noisy, terrible bathroom”
Reviews.Author: cbrehaut
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel room I've ever stayed in. The bathroom was the worst part: small, old. It was actually so bad that I didn't want use the shower. I could also hear all noises from the corridor, it was going through some kind of vent above the room door... which also let the light in. Terrible room. terrible night. I assume the hotel has better rooms than this one but I would not take a chance of ending-up with a room like this one. I will never sterp foot in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Back in time...for the fun of it”
Reviews.Author: RTown
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the San Carlos on a Saturday night in May. Our stay was for the fun of it as we alredy live in Phoenix. We had a east facing third floor room. The room and hotel was clean overall. The linens were bright white and floor was swept. The bathroom was clean and had a newer pedestal sink. The tub was clean but chipped. The water pressure was good and water was hot. I believe the current posted TA pictures are similar to the room we had. The AC was central and cool along with a ceiling fan. TV had limited amount of cable channels. The view from our room looked toward Chase Tower, but we could watch the people walking around and see some older builings down the street. The pool is on the third floor. Around the pool were nice setting areas that had screen coverings above. It was neat to see all the hallway pictures of old Phoenix and the artwork. The elevator was small. Easy to imagine when the elevator was manual. "Down to the first floor Jeeves.". The snack and beverage machines were reasonable priced. Ice machine worked fine. Things to do (movies, bars, eating) are close walking distance. Staying here you really are at the heart of downtown. Lots of history on this property. Be sure to check out the San Carlos website for some interesting trivia. Front desk and valet were very friendly. Recommend the valet parking. It is just a tad more and well worth not having to drive around finding the parking lot. We enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Pick This One”
Reviews.Author: TexasOnTheRun
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel. Tiny bathroom with no plugs. Disgusting shower with multiple cracks. Terrible TV channels. Hair from previous guests. No fitness room and you have to pay $6 to use a remote facility.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: mtheo
Reviews.Content: Never again will I fall sucker to the words "Boutique," "Classic" or "Historic." These are synonyms for decrepit and cramped. Yes, this hotel is 70 years old. It looks it. The decor hasn't changed a bit. I was never informed on Expedia that the restaurant would be out of commission during my stay or that the rooms are centrally heated and that there are NO temperature controls and the windows do NOT open. I was given a voucher for a restaurant two blocks away (the kitchen serves the hotel). I showed up for an early breakfast, but was told the restaurant wouldn't open until 7AM. When I returned to the lobby and explained I was hoping to get some breakfast, a local character in t-shirt, sock, sandals and a cigar stub offered to walk me to his favorite place. The next night I was awaked at midnight by incredibly loud music (I was on the third floor). I went downstairs to complain; the on-duty manager suggested I move to another floor. When I asked him why he wouldn't simply tell the live band in the hotel bar to stop playing, he shrugged his shoulders. And when I asked if there had been any other complaints, he said "Not since 11PM." The decor of the room is pathetic. No chair, other than a typical uncomfortable desk chair. One wastebasket (in the bathroom). Tiny, old-fixtured bathroom. Uncomfortable pillows. Thin towels. Now I understand why, when I registered, I was asked to check a box which stated that leaving a day early would cost me $50!

Reviews.Title: “stay someplace else!”
Reviews.Author: SOBChevyChase_MD
Reviews.Content: Walk in to a quaint lobby. Go upstairs to a nightmare! The room was from the 1950's; the walls were paper thin so you could hear everything your neighbor said and for some unexplained reason the tv didn't have abc, nbc, cbs or fox available.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value...Some Quirks”
Reviews.Author: Trippingman
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel for those traveling on a budget. We would have paid twice the amount for hotels one block over. If you are going to be attending a conference at the Convention Center, this is an easy walk. The good- The price Location Room size The bad- As mentioned, the showers are not the best. They have a hand held shower head mounted low on the wall. Also, the water goes from hot to cold and back, occasionally. It is noisy. You can hear neighbors conversations and traffic noise is a bit intrusive. Overall...I thought the good out wieghed the bad. I feel you get good value for the cost. FYI....Food choices. We liked Steve's Grill. Good Happy Hour Specials. The Matador Mexican resturant was not so good. The Compass on top of the Hyatt was an excellent choice for our group dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: Fastrack101
Reviews.Content: The hotel markets itself as an antique classic that has been restored to a "Hollywood" style glamor. NO WAY. I was thrilled to stay in an old-fashioned reconditioned hotel, but was uncomfortably surprised by just how "old" this place really is. Evidently, Hotel San Carlos has undergone some renovations in the recent past - but I can't for the life of me figure out what it involved (carpeting?). There are some charming features to be sure (the lobby looks like its glory days have long past, but if you squint hard enough you just might get a feel for the hotel's past). Otherwise, the hotel's rooms (bed, linen, bathroom, TV) all feel more like a MO-tel than a boutique hotel. And frankly, for this price I bet I can find a motel that has newer sheets and pillows. Oh, and I almost forgot - the shower's water pressure was equivalent to holding a small bottle of water and gently pouring it onto your head. No pressure at all. I do NOT recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: PhoenixAquaman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel over the weekend and loved it. The lady at the front counter was very friendly and professional, the building itself and the rooms are beautiful. The one thing to watch out for is the way the shower runs hot to cold, but it is an old building at that is to be expected. Overall, I enjoyed my stay and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, historic, comphy and lots of orbs”
Reviews.Author: msghosthunter
Reviews.Content: My husband and myself are amature ghost hunters and we had not been to the San Carlos before and the ghost tours were starting up again for Oct..We had a great time, the hotel is very interesting and our room was huge with a separate living room with a couch and TV. It also had this cute raised kitchen which I had never seen anything like this before. We had a nice lrg comfortable bed. Plus we got a big discount on our room for taking the ghost tour. The only complaint we had was there not being a resturant other than the Italian one in the lobby. It was good food but there was no place to go even for coffee. Everybody is so critical of this hotel because it old. If you want a luxurious hotel with all the bells and whistles the go to the Hyatt. If you are interested in history and can imagine the hotel like it was in it's hay day and appreciate the architecture and craftmanship that went into the more elaborate hotels of it's time then it would be worthwhile for you to stay here, otherwise you will be happier at the Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Save yourself, do NOT stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: Lea007
Reviews.Content: My husband and I live in Scottsdale, our social group decided to attend an event downtown. A friend showed us several news paper articles about the huge $$ remodel at the Hotel San Carlos. She got us an excellent group rate.We all were excited for the event and not having to drive home. We walked into the antiquated lobby and I almost turned around, it's clean but poorly decorated. My husband suggested that maybe they simply hadn't gotten to this area and to have patients. He sounded like the voice of reason, so I acquiest. The ladies room in the lobby looks like something in a Russian nightmare, I was told by the truly lovely woman at the front desk that this was newly remodeled. Go see for yourself, but be prepared you may want to vomit! The thread-bare carpet and rotting moldings in the hallway should have sounded an alarm to prepare me for the atrocities to come, but I was completely unprepared for this hotel 'suit'!! The furniture looked like early pioneer meets the '70's and the bathroom was more than hideous, including the nasty rusty old tub. Please do not stay here, even if it were gifted, it wasn't worth the ensuing trauma, The next morning at breakfast, our friend was mortified, it was difficult to comfort her as we all felt the same. I felt horrible for her as she had planned this celebration for some time. (oh yeah, the decor in the dining room, truly frightening) But we did manage a good laugh. We all left and where thrilled to shower and scrub ourselves in our own homes. This unfortunate time has since become a very private joke! We (our group) consider ourselves well traveled, broad minded and enjoy a variety of experiences, but this was to much. I/we all have empathy for the homeless and there plights but why they allowed a stinky homeless guy in the lobby claiming to be the owner, I can't say. I guess that explains the lateness of this review, just to difficult to revisit. It does make me wonder if and who they paid for these erroneous press releases??

Reviews.Title: “YUK!”
Reviews.Author: ollalola
Reviews.Content: What a dump! Save your money and stay at the local hostel - you'll get nicer accommodations, a quieter night's rest and food.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, comfortable and convenient as well as great value.”
Reviews.Author: Camperjenny
Reviews.Content: We were on a three-week holiday to Arizona and had booked only the first two nights of our visit - at the San Carlos - but loved the hotel so much that we stayed for another two and ended our vacation with four nights here. For English people, the hotel room is of normal size, and the staff could not have been more helpful. We were on the third floor, close to the swimming pool and deck, and with a street view. It was quiet, comfortable and although the decor is a little tired, the hotel had lots of character and the air-conditioning (vented to the rooms) was controllable individually and there was a ceiling fan, which made it cool when it was 107F outside. It was the cheapest hotel we stayed in and by far the best value, close to the light rail and buses. There is a computer in the lobby for guest use. We will stay here again. The Thai Elephant restaurant close by is excellent and there are plenty of places for breakfast nearby.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel but overall disappointing”
Reviews.Author: debrachel
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel thinking it would be nice to stay in a place that advertises itself as a boutique hotel. Essentially the beds were not only extremely hard but very small. We had a room with 2 full beds with my husband, myself and my teenaged son. We normally sleep on a king bed so even queens are a bit small for us. The website says they have new serta sleeper beds - they may have been new but they were definitely the least expensive of the bunch! The next thing that was disappointing was that the in-hotel restaurant wasn't open on the weekend, even though it advertised that it was. Phoenix itself was not what I expected. It seemed like the city was closed for the weekend. We ended up driving 3 hours to Tombstone for the day because no one could tell us anything to do with our son for the day.

Reviews.Title: “A ghost with a sense of humor?”
Reviews.Author: winggapo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in the last week of March, 2009 but other business has prevented me from having time to write about it until now, two months later. We had read the reviews on this site and some other sites about the quaintness and about how the bartender's specialty was blackberry mojitos, and of course the thrill of staying in a "haunted hotel". Like others we were lured to the hotel by the age of the hotel as I am a history buff and I will say that if you are looking to walk back into time into the 1930's then this place is for you. But, that having been said you have to keep in mind the hotels from that period. Some of the accomodations have been updated and a large part have not. I expected extremely small rooms and the Hotel San Carlos did not dissapoint, in fact one of the spare bedrooms in my home was about the same size as our hotel room and I have a small home. The hotel did not help the confinement by furnishing the room with a large amoire and television that took a whole corner up. The bathroom was too small for two people to be in at once unless one stood in the shower, whereas the toilet and sink were somewhat new the plumbing hooked to it was the original plumbing. In the shower you could see where some of the tiles had been removed to put in the usual one handle shower control and take out the two handles that were common for the era. They couldn't match the tiles back up exactly. There was a small tattering of a sign in the shower that advertised that water temperature could fluctuate with water pressure and boy they weren't kidding when my wife flushed the toilet while I was showering and scalded the heck out me. I could only hope that it didn't carry into the next hotel room and I wasn't scalding some guy or gal taking a shower in there whenever I flushed. There is no insulation in the walls, and I don't believe they even knew what it was when the place was built way back when. Consequently I could hear the person next door gently snoring through the night but it wasn't overwhelming and luckily we had a room at the end of the hall on the 3rd floor so we only had one common room wall. I would say that if you decide to say here the 3rd floor accesses the pool on the roof and when we went out to the pool at midnight there were a lot of young people from the bar downstairs who had congregated to the poolside tables to continue drinking so I would think that those rooms at the end of that hallway would be a problem for excessive noise. The Marilyn Monroe suite is right at the end of that hallway on the 3rd floor and shares a common wall with the pool area. I told my wife before we arrived that if they still had the old key locked door locks we would have to leave our luggage in the trunk of the car when not in the room, but they had moved into the 21st century on that one with the card swipe locks, which was a relief. There is no parking on site, but with your room fee they give you a day pass for the parking structure one block to the East. There were some street people out begging and stuff between the hotel and the parking structure but since Arizona honors all concealed weapons permits and I have one from my home state of Nevada we just walked on past and ignored them. Anyone reading this who has a permit can contact the Department of Public Safety and veryify that your permit will allow carry in this state. Anyway, the street people weren't bothersome. We checked in and were totally impressed with the downstairs lobby complete with its plated copper elevators from the period. After dropping our luggage in the room we went through the hallways taking pics with our digital cameras of the pictures, etc. Just normal stuff was captured. Then we went and sat at the pool for a while and dipped our hands into it just to say that we had touched the pool water where Marilyn Monroe used to swim, but we didn't actually jump in. This was early in the evening and we were alone in the pool area. We went down to the lobby and took photos of the restaurant and bar and then decided to go out and have dinner at one of my favorite places in Phoenix, Rustler's Rooste up on South Mountain, where you can actually get rattlesnake for an appetizer. As we got out of the elevator on the third floor lobby to go to our room and change for dinner there was the overpowering smell of flowers or perfume or something in the lobby. I asked my wife "what is that smell?" and she said that it was the floral arrangement in the lobby. I told her "go check...all the flowers up here are artificial". After picking at a bunch of atificial flowers she said "so, it's somebody"s perfume". I said "yeah....whose" as from the lobby you can see down all three hallways and we were the only one's there. We looked at each other and I took two pictures with my digital camera and suddenly her cell phone rang inside her purse. This was a kind of red flag with me as I work nights at a casino position on the Vegas Strip and this was about ten minutes after I normally start work, so I thought "uh huh, someone didn't get the message that I wasn't at work tonight". I asked my wife "who's calling you at this time of night?" She replied "I don't know" as she opened her purse and took out the phone. She opened her phone cover and looked at me and said "you are!" I said "I'm not calling you, I'm standing here with my hands on the camera!" I reached for my Samsung Rant in the pouch on my belt and was astonished to see that it was active and had dialed the last number called even though the Rant keyboard locks automatically after ten seconds of non use and two buttons must be pushed in succession to unlock it. My phone had called my wife's phone right next to me! While we pondered for a minute over whether my phone had an electonics issue, my wife looked at me and said "notice something....the scent's gone." Gone it was and so was my chance for any other photos . At dinner my wife said that the event was "impressive", but I told her, "I don't think so, but it was kind of [--]up! If it had wanted to be impressive it would have sent a text message, something like "I do not smell like flowers , you dumb [--]" As it was it not only made me a little concerned but also cost me my chance for anymore photos. Anyway, that's my weird story for the place, make of it what you will. We noticed some other oddities later on that evening, but that could have been from a somewhat then heightened sense of imagination after the phone event. After coming back in from dinner we grabbed a maintenance guy changing light bulbs in the main lobby chandeliers and engaged him in some conversation and he was quite sociable, but as soon as I changed the topic to ghosts (which now was my foremost thought after the phone thing) this guy turned from nice to ice in like two seconds flat and walked away. Apparently the property owners do not want any of this discussed and are happy that most guests only complain or are concerned about the small rooms. Oh, and when we went to the bar for blackberry mojitos the bartender met us with a "what's that?" response. He said that the last bartender was a mixologist specialist of some kind but he only pours beer and stuff. In the morning we were behind a host of other guests complaining about their rooms and trying to get some compensation back. One last thing for staying here: when you leave the parking garage you actually come out on the other end of the garage from which you entered which means an immediate right turn upon exit and at the next light will bring you back to the hotel. The garage will get you turned around and if go left upon exit you will get to navigate a bunch of Phoenix's one way streets trying to find your way back. Also the attendent in the garage was creepier than any ghost could ever be as he took my hotel ticket, argued with me that I did not need it to reenter and then suddenly gave it back with a "here's your ticket sir, you can't get back into without it" just as we were about to drive out. Lot's of luck on that one.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: coopdedoo
Reviews.Content: The good--We stayed here while my SO went to a conference. The location couldn't have been better--right on the light rail and minutes away from the Heard Museum, Art Museum etc... He could walk to the convention center in 5 minutes. Nice pool area. The rooms are indeed small but that didn't bother me. Staff is friendly and helpful. We were there mid-week with a low rate of $44 so I was happy. Fun art on the walls and a genteel feel to the place. The not so good--Plumbing is old and erratic and the shower was quite small. No parking but there is a public lot nearby for $12 max a day. Not sure if you can go in and out though.

Reviews.Title: “PLease do not stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: MaOlive
Reviews.Content: I realize that this is an old hotel, and since I live in a home that is even older, I can appreciate some "quirkiness". However, this so called hotel is the worst place I have ever stayed in. The first room (yes, we moved as soon as possible) had a bathroom that was so narrow that when you bent over to wash your face, you bumped your head on the mirror. There was only a shower, and that had a drain which had collapsed into the tile floor. The tiles in the bathroom were chipped, cracked or missing all together. The bedspread was stained and the carpet was filthy. The 2nd room was not much better, although at least it had a tub, but the paint was peeling and, the tiles had the same issues. Each room offered 2 horrible pillows, no extra blankets and the towels felt like they were original to the hotel. We could hear the person in the next room coughing during the night, and his early morning phone call. The icing on the cake is when we were checking out, we passed an exterminator in the halls! My husband described the place quite simply - " a cruddy place". I have pictures if you need more convincing to not spend one minute in this place.

Reviews.Title: “Never again at this price.”
Reviews.Author: wdaven
Reviews.Content: I was in Phoenix for a convention and tried to save my organization some money since I do not share a room. While somewhat cheaper than the Sheraton, Hyatt, et al., the San Carlos can always fill because of overflow and overbooking at surrounding hotels. It is Historic and it is OLD, too. One of my colleagues did experience a strange encounter but I really think it was a homeless person roaming the hall. Rooms are small. The closet is bigger than the bath. You have to exit the bathroom to turn around and there is no place to put things in it. It is also nasty. The A/C is central. You have no control. It gets hot and it gets cold. Because of constantly changing water pressure it is impossible to take a shower (and there is no tub) without getting scalded. TV reception is limited and horrible. No amenities other than free internet which doesn't work all the time. The staff are very friendly but don't take care of anything you ask them to. Note they charge an early departure fee which may prevent yo from leaving early because you don't like the place. You would be better served to stay in one of the burbs and commute in. Parking is reasonable at parking garages and the the money you would save along with the better accomidations would be worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: vivapilates
Reviews.Content: Visiting downtown Phoenix for a conference this is a much more pleasant option than the big commercial hotels. The rooms were large and well furnished, the location is fantastic. But it is the friendly, helpful staff that make this a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, great history, fun for downtown guests.”
Reviews.Author: aharden
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while visiting town for a friend's wedding. This hotel wasn't the closest but we wanted to check out the downtown area while we were here, and stay at a "haunted" hotel. Nothing supernatural happened to us while at this hotel, but to be fair we were only here one night. The rooms were just big enough for us, not spacious but comfortable enough. The wireless was more secure than a lot of other hotels, you needed to log in to use it, but it was still included in the price of the room which I didn't expect in a downtown hotel. Unloading at check in was a little confusing because we arrived facing the opposite direction of the valet stand, which doesn't really have a designated area to pull into, it's just curbside parking which is fine if you arrive at the hotel with it to your right. The clerk at check in (and out) since it was the same lady, was very nice and gave us a little history about the hotel and told us where the pool was and chatted for a bit. The pool was a little small, but it was just nice enough to get a little dip, not great for swimming laps if that is your thing. The pool deck is nice though, lots of chairs and space to lounge. It was really cool to swim in a pool that Marilyn Monroe swam in too. That was probably the highlight of the hotel, other than the awesome coffee stand outside on the street. It is located just outside the restaurant next to the valet stand. The guy who was running it the two days we were there was awesome, I believe that his name was John. And he made some great drinks and they were so reasonably priced. I didn't expect that in the city. The only thing that was bad about this stay was that the day of check out we were packing up and the phone books fell out of the closet and a pair of underwear were hidden behind the phone books on the shelf. Housekeeping must have missed them, but working in hotels I think that was kind of a big deal. I didn't make a big deal about it but know that it would have been bad if someone else had found them. We just took a garbage bag and threw it over them and tied it off and put it with the rest of our trash. We didn't want the chance that they would be left again. Other than that the rest of the room was clean and comfortable. I am sure that was just a fluke and the hotel was not even aware of it. I would give them another chance if we were going to stay in downtown Phoenix again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Dissapointing, overrated hotel”
Reviews.Author: nyflanctraveler
Reviews.Content: I am not the pickiest traveler but I do enjoy a nice hotel. This was listed as a 3 star and it couldn't have been further from that. It was a complete no-frills hotel if I have ever seen one before. Everything was old and there really wasn't one nice thing I can say about it after I left or while I was there. They try to impress you with putting old actors/actresses names on doors who supposedly stayed in those rooms but the problem is the rooms are probably exactly the way they were 60 years ago without a thing being done to them. There are loud pool parties on the weekends which to me draws a thuggy type crowd and you could smell the smoke all throughout the hallway. I was there on a wekend to see a baseball game and let me tell you for a Saturday night there wasn't a thing open in sight. You also have to park your car in a desolated parking garage which you don't feel real safe about leaving your car in. Another bad thing is that there are vents above the door which do nothing but allow you to hear everything that is going on. Overall horrible hotel and would never go back again. Bathrooms were a joke!!

Reviews.Title: “Historic, or just old?”
Reviews.Author: Ruswalsh
Reviews.Content: The good news: excellent location, clean rooms, friendly staff, rooftop pool, good price. The bad news: tiny bathroom, luke warm shower, tired restaurant. Depends on how charming you find the old gal.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, noisy, good deal??”
Reviews.Author: Patoisie
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the San Carlos on business, attracted by the comparatively low rate and its location. The San Carlos is located on the corner of Central and Monroe, very convenient to the new light rail and within walking distance of all major downtown venues (the Herberger and Dodge Theaters, US Airways Center, Chase Field, the convention center). The room was small and and the bathroom tiny, but the furnishings, although outdated, were comfortable, and we had a nice streetscape view from our top-floor window. (The hotel is L-shaped, and rooms in the back apparently have poor views.) The main problem with our room was the noise: the doors are poorly insulated (there is a vent above, and a large gap below the door), and it seems as though the slightest bit of conversation in the hall is being held right next to your bed. Light streams through the gap at night as well. Staff were helpful and friendly but unprofessional. Parking is available down the street at a covered parking garage. Breakfast at the Silver Spoon Cafe located in the first floor corner of the building was good (bacon and eggs freshly prepared) but served essentially as a take-out meal. And a word about our "deal"--Compare rates; sometimes they are the same as the newer, more luxurious downtown hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled”
Reviews.Author: Esfelipe
Reviews.Content: Lots of disappointments. We arrived at 5:00 PM on Saturday. There was no valet. Parking was two blocks away. No bellman to help with the bags. Small rooms were expected, but light emitting vents over the door was not. The place was noisy, as there were no double paned windows and the vents in the bathroom were like a megaphone to others rooms! Shower was clogged, it took 20 minutes for the drain to go down. Worst of all was the lack of advertised wireless internet. The connection kept dropping after one or two minutes making any kind of web work impossible! Staff gave an explanation which was not believable by anyone with even the basics of networking, let alone an IP professional. If they don't know, then say so...don't give me a story. Did I mention that there was no food service on Sunday morning? The clerk cheerfully directed guests to a diner four blocks away, which was closed! Bottom line: We will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “nice old hotel”
Reviews.Author: michael_stunt
Reviews.Content: very nice old hotel , good atmosphere , but you have to like old things, my room was old ,but nice and clean , staff was friendly , nice pool and hotel bar . the surroundings is ok in dayligths but deserted at nigth . michael. denmark.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: toflyer
Reviews.Content: I can't believe this Hotel qualifed for a 3 1/2 star rating on Priceline, yet brand new Marriots and Sheratons go in the 4 catagory. This Hotel should be 2. Very old, very noisey, unbelievably small, the bathroom is pretty bad, so small, the shower stall is ancient. I walked in, and walked out over to the Sheraton. Too bad I can't get my money back from Priceline, but that didn't stop me from leaving, I wouldn't stay a night let alone 5 nights in this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Historical Downtown Experience”
Reviews.Author: Champion46
Reviews.Content: The Hotel San Carlos has a great downtown location. My group of friends we able to walk to several places for breakfast, dinner, and drinks. The hotel was very reasonabally priced. The hotel was quite historical and had a very cool feel. As many histocal hotels the rooms and bathroom were small, but my group had no complaints on how clean their rooms were. The ladies at the front desk were very nice and the bartenders were very attentive and helpfull with information on downtown Phoenix. The only dissapointment was one evening we had dinner in the dinning room and the kitchen was very slow. I will stay there again and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “It's historic and lovely!!”
Reviews.Author: KerrilynnAZ
Reviews.Content: The reviews of those who don't think this is a wonderful historic place SURPRISED ME! Oh My! I mean, I'm a 40something and hip at that and I find this place to be awesome! The decor is elegant inside the lobby. We had dinner in the main dining room and I had the best shrimp fettucini with Arizona fig that I can't wait to try something else. I've been in this hotel during the weekday and weekends and found it to be a safe environment out on the streets. You see all types of people around, but I've yet to see a homeless person as one suggested. There is outdoor seating that is comfortable and perfect for sitting outside and watching the passerby's... I highly suggest taking a stroll through history! Look at the pictures, red the menu's from way back in the day and see what dime will cost you! Take a peek in the curio case and see if you can find Marilyn Monroe's drivers license among other treasurers. And if you want to see something spooky... look at the first picture of the BAR, notice that just right of center towards the bottom is a royal blue orb of some sort. I was shocked to find this on the picture...But if you follow ghostly fodder... well, it is what it is...

Reviews.Title: “Old tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: CDeanI
Reviews.Content: This hotel is old and tired. The rooms are small like a New York hotel. The bathroom is extremely old. The shower water temp goes up and down and you can barely move in the bathroom. The furnishings are old and the bed wasnt very good. There was a small window with no view and there was no climate control in the room. You can hear every word clearly in the hallways which will wake you up in the middle of the night. There is no on site parking and you have to walk 2 blocks to park. Positives: It was only $40 on priceline. The staff was very nice. It is only about a 10 minute walk to the basketball arena and a 15 minute walk to the baseball park.

Reviews.Title: “Sleep on the streets it's better”
Reviews.Author: avidreader1964
Reviews.Content: This hotel is by far the WORST I have ever stayed in. It's an overpriced albatross. In the shower (where the bathroom tiles are falling out - I have pictures), the water temperature changes without warning and you go from okay to being scalded then to freezing. On Friday, Saturday, and Sunday nights the hotel throws drunken pool parties to 3 a.m. and the rest of the hotel cannot sleep (my friend was three floors up and was kept awake). During these drunken parties regular hotel guests cannot use the pool nor can their children. After three days of this the pool was closed for two days so they could clean the leftover gunk from the pool water so we still couldn't use the pool. The room temperature is hotel controlled not individually room controlled so you freeze or boil at the hotel's whim. The pillows are harder than BRICKS and when you politely request a softer pillow you are told the "all hotels have their shortcomings" but that is ALL this hotel has - SHORTCOMINGS. The staff with the exception of the maids and two other people are the rudest and nastiest I have ever met. One hotel employee took a special interest in the comings and goings of my daughter and myself and moved into the room across the hall from us and was caught going through our garbage! I have politely and repeatedly attempted to contact management about my experience to prevent other guests from going through such a deplorable experience and they refuse to return calls and the desk clerks are crude and nasty and refuse to even give me the general manager's working hours! What is this a matter of national security? Sleep in your car before you sleep in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, be open minded and set yourself back in time.”
Reviews.Author: cfbluther
Reviews.Content: This hotel sometimes gets bad reviews, but I understand why. You have to set yourself a bit back in time. We are used to modern facilites with big rooms and fancy things. We stayed this past Saturday and overall, I would stay here again. Trust me I am a hotel snob, but I took myself back and really enjoyed the stay. The place was very clean and the staff was extremely friendly. Yes the room was small and the bathroom even smaller, but again go back to that era. They do charge $10 for parking, which is one block over, but the Hyatt around the corner charges $22. Besides the walk won't kill you. The bar area was a nice place to chill. Great staff and cheap top shelf drinks. So, if you are open minded, stay here. Not a bad place for being 100 years old. GK

Reviews.Title: “Abs gross”
Reviews.Author: dusty_travelers
Reviews.Content: Well, it was a place where u hesitate to touch anythng. Including the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away if you actually want to SLEEP”
